Welcome to REST API Contacts documentation!¶

REST API main¶

async main.index()¶
async main.startup()¶

REST API repository Contacts¶

async src.repository.contacts.create_contact(body: ContactModel, user: User, db: Session) → Contact¶

Removes a single contact with the specified ID for a specific user.

Parameters:

  • contact_id (int) – The ID of the contact to remove.

  • user (User) – The user to remove the contact for.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

The removed note, or None if it does not exist.

Return type:

Contact | None

async src.repository.contacts.find_contact(search_string: str, user: User, db: Session) → Contact¶

Finds a contact by specified search string, searching in contacts name, last name or email. Search string can be in the beginning, inside, or end of the search fields, or can fully match.

Parameters:

  • search_string (str) – the string used to search in the contact fields.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

The contact whose name, last name or email contains the search string, or None if it does not exist.

Return type:

Contact | None

async src.repository.contacts.get_contact(contact_id: int, user: User, db: Session) → Contact¶

Retrieves a single contact with the specified ID for a specific user.

Parameters:

  • contact_id (int) – The ID of the note to retrieve.

  • user (User) – The user to retrieve the contact for.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

The contact with the specified ID, or None if it does not exist.

Return type:

Contact | None

async src.repository.contacts.get_contacts(skip: int, limit: int, user: User, db: Session) → List[Contact]¶

Retrieves a list of contacts for a specific user with specified pagination parameters.

Parameters:

  • skip (int) – The number of contacts to skip.

  • limit (int) – The maximum number of contacts to return.

  • user (User) – The user to retrieve contacts for.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

A list of contacts.

Return type:

List[contact]

async src.repository.contacts.remove_contact(contact_id: int, user: User, db: Session) → Contact | None¶

Removes a single contact with the specified ID for a specific user.

Parameters:

  • contact_id (int) – The ID of the contact to remove.

  • user (User) – The user to remove the contact for.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

The removed contact, or None if it does not exist.

Return type:

Contact | None

async src.repository.contacts.seven_days(user: User, db: Session) → List[Contact]¶

Retrieves all contacts who have birthday during next 7 days for a specific user.

Parameters:

user (User) – The user to retrieve contacts for.

Returns:

A list of contacts.

Return type:

List[contact]

async src.repository.contacts.update_contact(contact_id: int, body: ContactUpdate, user: User, db: Session) → Contact | None¶

Updates a single contact with the specified ID for a specific user.

Parameters:

  • contact_id (int) – The ID of the contact to update.

  • body (contactUpdate) – The updated data for the contact.

  • user (User) – The user to update the contact for.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

The updated contact, or None if it does not exist.

Return type:

Contact | None

REST API repository Users¶

async src.repository.users.confirmed_email(email: str, db: Session) → None¶

Mark a user’s email as confirmed in the database.

This function updates the confirmation status of a user’s email in the database to indicate that the email has been successfully confirmed.

Parameters:

  • email (str) – email which is used to confirm a user and has to belong to him.

  • db (Session) – the database session.

async src.repository.users.create_user(body: UserModel, db: Session) → User¶

Crates a new user in the database using pydantic schema UserModel.

Parameters:

  • body (UserModel) – pydantic schema validating username, email and password.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

newly created user

Return type:

User

async src.repository.users.get_user_by_email(email: str, db: Session) → User¶

Gets a user from the database using specified email. Emails have to be unique for each user. This function is used by other functions in this module and routes.auth module.

Parameters:

  • email (str) – the email of the user we want to get.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

user, or None if it does not exist.

Return type:

User | None

async src.repository.users.update_avatar(email, url: str, db: Session) → User¶

Updates the avatar of a user using his email.

Parameters:

  • email (str) – email which is used to confirm a user and has to belong to him.

  • url (str) – the url pointing to users avatar.

  • db (Session) – the database session.

Return type:

User

async src.repository.users.update_token(user: User, token: str | None, db: Session) → None¶

Updates a JWT token for specified user.

Parameters:

  • user (User) – User to update the token for.

  • token (str | None) – JWT token to update.

  • db (Session) – the database session.

REST API routes Contacts¶

async src.routes.contacts.congrat_contacts(current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

Retrieve a list of contacts of current user with upcoming birthdays.

Parameters:

  • current_user (User) – User instance representing the authenticated user.

  • db (Session) – SQLAlchemy database session obtained from the get_db dependency.

Returns:

List of contacts with upcoming birthdays.

Return type:

List[ContactResponse]

async src.routes.contacts.create_contact(body: ContactModel, current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

Create a new contact in current user’s contact list.

Parameters:

  • body (ContactModel) – Contact information to be created.

  • current_user (User) – User instance representing the authenticated user.

  • db (Session) – SQLAlchemy database session obtained from the get_db dependency.

Returns:

Created contact information.

Return type:

ContactResponse

async src.routes.contacts.find_contact_by_name_last_name_or_email(search_string: str, current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

Find a contact (from current user contact list) by name, last name, or email.

Parameters:

  • search_string (str) – String to search for in the contact’s name, last name, or email.

  • current_user (User) – User instance representing the authenticated user.

  • db (Session) – SQLAlchemy database session obtained from the get_db dependency.

Returns:

Contact information matching the search string.

Return type:

ContactResponse

async src.routes.contacts.read_contact(contact_id: int, current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

Retrieve a single contact of current user by its ID.

Parameters:

  • contact_id (int) – ID of the contact to retrieve.

  • current_user (User) – User instance representing the authenticated user.

  • db (Session) – SQLAlchemy database session obtained from the get_db dependency.

Returns:

Contact information.

Return type:

ContactResponse

async src.routes.contacts.read_contacts(skip: int = 0, limit: int = 100, db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

Retrieve a list of contacts for a specific user with specified pagination parameters.

Parameters:

  • skip (int) – Number of contacts to skip.

  • limit (int) – Maximum number of contacts to retrieve.

  • db (Session) – SQLAlchemy database session obtained from the get_db dependency.

  • current_user (User) – User instance representing the authenticated user.

Returns:

List of contacts.

Return type:

List[ContactResponse]

async src.routes.contacts.remove_contact(contact_id: int, current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

Remove a contact from current user’s contact list.

Parameters:

  • contact_id (int) – ID of the contact to be removed.

  • current_user (User) – User instance representing the authenticated user.

  • db (Session) – SQLAlchemy database session obtained from the get_db dependency.

Returns:

Removed contact information.

Return type:

ContactResponse

async src.routes.contacts.update_contact(body: ContactUpdate, contact_id: int, current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

Update an existing contact in current user’s contact list..

Parameters:

  • body (ContactUpdate) – Contact information to be updated.

  • contact_id (int) – ID of the contact to be updated.

  • current_user (User) – User instance representing the authenticated user.

  • db (Session) – SQLAlchemy database session obtained from the get_db dependency.

Returns:

Updated contact information.

Return type:

ContactResponse

REST API routes Users¶

async src.routes.users.read_users_me(current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

Get the current user’s information.

Parameters:

current_user (User) – User instance representing the authenticated user.

Returns:

User information.

Return type:

UserDb

async src.routes.users.update_avatar_user(file: UploadFile = File(PydanticUndefined), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

Update the user’s avatar using Cloudinary API.

Parameters:

  • file (UploadFile) – Uploaded avatar image file.

  • current_user (User) – User instance representing the authenticated user.

  • db (Session) – SQLAlchemy database session obtained from the get_db dependency.

Returns:

User information with updated avatar.

Return type:

UserDb

REST API routes Auth¶

async src.routes.auth.confirmed_email(token: str, db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

Confirm a user’s email using the provided token.

Parameters:

  • token (str) – Token sent to the user’s email for confirmation.

  • db (Session) – SQLAlchemy database session obtained from the get_db dependency.

Returns:

Returns a message (JSON object) indicating the result of email confirmation.

Return type:

dict

async src.routes.auth.login(body: OAuth2PasswordRequestForm = Depends(OAuth2PasswordRequestForm), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

Log in a user and generate access and refresh tokens.

Parameters:

  • body (OAuth2PasswordRequestForm) – OAuth2 password request form containing the username (email) and password.

  • db (Session) – SQLAlchemy database session obtained from the get_db dependency.

Returns:

Returns a dictionary (JSON object) containing the access token, refresh token, and token type.

Return type:

dict

async src.routes.auth.refresh_token(credentials: HTTPAuthorizationCredentials = Security(HTTPBearer), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

Refresh the access token using the provided refresh token.

Parameters:

  • credentials (HTTPAuthorizationCredentials) – HTTP Authorization credentials containing the refresh token.

  • db (Session) – SQLAlchemy database session obtained from the get_db dependency.

Returns:

Returns a dictionary (JSON object) containing the new access token, refresh token, and token type.

Return type:

dict

async src.routes.auth.request_email(body: RequestEmail, background_tasks: BackgroundTasks, request: Request, db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

Send a confirmation email to the user.

Parameters:

  • body (RequestEmail) – Request body containing the user’s email.

  • background_tasks (BackgroundTasks) – Object of the fastapi class BackgroundTasks used to start email sending in the background.

  • request (Request) – An instance of the fastapi class Request representing the incoming HTTP request.

  • db (Session) – SQLAlchemy database session obtained from the get_db dependency.

Returns:

Returns a message (JSON object) indicating the result of email sending.

Return type:

dict

async src.routes.auth.signup(body: UserModel, background_tasks: BackgroundTasks, request: Request, db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

Router to signup a new user and create him in database, sending him confirmation email in the background.

Parameters:

  • body (UserModel) – pydantic schema validating username, email and password.

  • background_tasks – the instance of of fastapi class ‘BackgroundTasks’ which is used to start confirmation

email sending in the background :type background_tasks: BackgroundTasks :param request: An instance of the fastapi class Request, representing the incoming HTTP request. It contains information about the current request, including the URL :type request: Request :param db: SQLAlchemy database session obtained from the get_db dependency. :type db: Session :return: Returns a dictionary (JSON object) containing information about the new user and a success message. :rtype: dict

REST API service Auth¶

class src.services.auth.Auth¶

Bases: object

Authentication service providing methods for password hashing, token creation, and user verification.

Attributes: pwd_context (CryptContext): Password hashing context. SECRET_KEY (str): Secret key for token encoding. ALGORITHM (str): Token encoding algorithm. oauth2_scheme (OAuth2PasswordBearer): OAuth2 password bearer scheme. r (redis.Redis): Redis client for caching user data.

ALGORITHM = 'algo1'¶
SECRET_KEY = 'some_secret_key'¶
async create_access_token(data: dict, expires_delta: float | None = None)¶

Create an access token for the provided data.

Parameters:

  • data (dict) – Data to include in the token payload.

  • expires_delta (float) – Optional expiration time for the token in seconds.

Returns:

Access token.

Return type:

str

create_email_token(data: dict)¶

Creates an email confirmation token.

Parameters:

data (dict) – Data to include in the token payload.

Returns:

Email confirmation token.

Return type:

str

async create_refresh_token(data: dict, expires_delta: float | None = None)¶

Create a refresh token for the provided data.

Parameters:

  • data (dict) – Data to include in the token payload.

  • expires_delta (float) – Optional expiration time for the token in seconds.

Returns:

Refresh token.

Return type:

str

async decode_refresh_token(refresh_token: str)¶

Decode a refresh token and extract the email from it.

Parameters:

refresh_token (str) – Refresh token.

Returns:

Extracted email.

Return type:

str

Raises:

HTTPException – If the token is invalid or has an invalid scope.

async get_current_user(token: str = Depends(OAuth2PasswordBearer), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

Get the current user based on the provided access token.

Parameters:

  • token (str) – Access token.

  • db (Session) – SQLAlchemy database session obtained from the get_db dependency.

Returns:

Current user.

Return type:

User

Raises:

HTTPException – If the token is invalid, has an invalid scope, or the user cannot be retrieved.

async get_email_from_token(token: str)¶

Decode a token and extract the email from it.

Parameters:

token (str) – Token containing the email.

Returns:

Extracted email.

Return type:

str

Raises:

HTTPException – If the token is invalid or the email is not found.

get_password_hash(password: str)¶

Generates a hash for the provided password.

Parameters:

password (str) – Password to hash.

Returns:

Hashed password.

Return type:

str

oauth2_scheme = <fastapi.security.oauth2.OAuth2PasswordBearer object>¶
pwd_context = <CryptContext>¶
r = Redis<ConnectionPool<Connection<host=localhost,port=6379,db=0>>>¶
verify_password(plain_password, hashed_password)¶

Verifies the provided plain password against a hashed password.

Parameters:

  • plain_password (str) – Plain password.

  • hashed_password (str) – Hashed password.

Returns:

True if the passwords match, False otherwise.

Return type:

bool

REST API service Email¶

async src.services.email.send_email(email: EmailStr, username: str, host: str)¶

Send a confirmation email to the provided email address.

Parameters:

  • email (EmailStr) – Email address of the recipient.

  • username (str) – Username of the recipient.

  • host (str) – Host URL for generating confirmation link.
